title: Bullying Support - Real Talk
description: Strategic advice from someone who gets it

messages: Damn, dealing with bullies is exhausting
Let's figure out how to handle this without making it worse
What's the situation?
Social attacks hit different. They want you to react
Here's the thing - they're showing everyone how insecure THEY are
You responding gives them power. Your silence makes them irrelevant
Some power moves that actually work:
1. The 'unbothered' - literally act like they don't exist
2. The 'redirect' - 'weird flex but ok' and walk away
3. The 'confidence bomb' - 'thanks for thinking about me so much' + smile
Which feels more like you?
The gray rock method - become too boring to bully
They want a reaction. Give them NOTHING
Practice your 'unbothered' face in the mirror
When they talk, literally look through them like they're air
Real comebacks that work:
'I'm confused, was that supposed to hurt?'
'You seem really invested in my life'
'K.' (then walk away)
laugh 'That's wild' continue with your day
The key: sound genuinely confused, not defensive
If you want backup, here's how to get adults to actually DO something:
Document everything - dates, times, what they said
Tell them you're building a case for legal action
Mention you're considering transferring schools
Adults move faster when they think you might sue
Why they're actually doing this (spoiler: they're miserable):
They're projecting their own shit onto you
That's about them, not you
Boring people don't get bullied - you're interesting
They wouldn't target you if you weren't a threat
This is actually preparing you to handle adult assholes
You're learning psychology in real-time
You already are superior - you're not the one being pathetic
Rate your confidence right now 1-10
What would make YOU feel powerful in this situation?
What's your move if you knew you couldn't lose?
Think about it - you're the one with options
They're stuck being pathetic. You're growing stronger
You're getting it. Now let's level up:
How to spot their insecurities and use them
Social dynamics - how to flip the script
What outcome do you actually want here?
If shit gets real, here are the power moves:
Document everything for legal action
Transfer schools FROM A POSITION OF POWER
Use their behavior against them publicly
Turn their friends (strategic social moves)
Physical threats are different. Safety first:
Avoid them completely - change your route
Stay in public places with witnesses
Record everything on your phone
Tell multiple adults - make it their problem
Digital warfare tactics:
Screenshot everything - we're building a case
Block party - make them irrelevant
The reverse uno - report their accounts first
Going ghost - strategic social media breaks
Social isolation is psychological warfare:
They want you to feel alone. Don't let them win
Find your people outside school - online communities, clubs
Quality over quantity - one real friend > 100 fake ones
This is temporary. High school ends. Real life begins
Building your case:
Keep a detailed log - dates, times, witnesses
Save all texts, social media posts, videos
Tell teachers, counselors, parents - in writing
If they ignore it, that's on them, not you
Your action plan:
1. Pick your battles - not everything needs a response
2. Build your support system - real friends, family
3. Focus on your goals - they're temporary, your future isn't
4. Remember: you're the one with options
What's your first move going to be?

options.text: I'm going to ignore them completely

messages: Perfect. You've got this.
